wikipedia_page.main: Joshua "Josh" Heard (born 29 November 1994) is a Welsh-born Canadian professional soccer player who plays as an attacking midfielder for Pacific FC.

During the 2021 Canadian Premier League season, Hojabrpour provided his first assist for the club on July 17 to Josh Heard against Forge FC.https://canpl.ca/article/match-analysis-pacific-fc-1-2-forge-fc He scored his first goal for Pacific on October 6 against FC Edmonton at Clarke Stadium.https://canpl.ca/article/match-analysis-fc-edmonton-2-1-pacific-fc Hojabrpour helped Pacific reach their first CPL final on November 20, 2021 after a 2–1 extra time win over Cavalry FC at ATCO Field.https://canpl.ca/article/recap-pacific-fc-earn-spot-in-final-with-2-1-extra-time-win-over-cavalry-fc On December 4, 2021, he was nominated for the league's under-21 player of the year award at the end of the 2021 season.https://canpl.ca/article/canadian-premier-league-announces-2021-awards-nominees On December 5, 2021, Hojabrpour scored the winning goal to win Pacific the 2021 Canadian Premier League Final at Tim Hortons Field.https://canpl.ca/article/recap-pacific-fc-crowned-canadian-premier-league-champions-with-1-0-win-vs-forge On December 14, he was named the 2021 Under-21 player of the year. In January 2022, Pacific announced Hojabrpour would be departing the club.
